snippet: A United Nations appeals court on Friday unexpectedly overturned the war crimes convictions of two Croatian generals involved in an offensive that resulted in the death of hundreds of Serbian civilians.
abstract: United Nations appeals court in The Hague unexpectedly overturns war crimes convictions of Croatian generals Ante Gotovina and Mladen Markac, who led 1995 campaign that helped end wars involving Serbia, Bosnia and Croatia but also left several hundred Serbian civilians dead and drove more than 150,000 from their homes.
lead_paragraph: A United Nations appeals court on Friday unexpectedly overturned the war crimes convictions of two Croatian generals involved in an offensive that resulted in the death of hundreds of Serbian civilians.

headline.seo: Hague Court Overturns Convictions of 2 Croatian Generals
headline.main: Hague Court Overturns Convictions of 2 Croatian Generals Over a 1995 Offensive
headline.print_headline: Hague Court Overturns Convictions of 2 Croatian Generals Over a 1995 Offensive
